triples.name: Statistical inference
triples.relevance: The paper examines how statistical inference procedures are applied to psychological hypotheses and identifies misalignments between verbal and statistical expressions.

triples.name: Mixed model
triples.relevance: Linear mixed models are the primary focus of the paper's critique regarding underspecified random effects in psychological research.

triples.name: Random effects model
triples.relevance: The paper argues that random effects formalism is underutilized in psychology, impacting generalizability and increasing false-positive rates.

triples.name: Replication crisis
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that failure to align verbal and statistical hypotheses is a fundamental cause of psychology's replication crisis.

triples.name: Statistical hypothesis test
triples.relevance: The paper examines how hypothesis testing procedures are applied to psychological theories and the misalignment issues that arise from this process.
